newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY O/N RATES CLIMB UP TO 22.25 PERCENT.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY O/N RATES CLIMB UP TO 22.25 PERCENT.

text.p: Hungary's overnight rates continued to climb up slowly on Wednesday, suprising many dealers following Monday's repo rate cuts.
The overnight money closed at around 22.25, slightly up from Tuesday's 22.125 closing.

"Expectations of repo cuts had been strong (before the cuts)," said Sandor Szatmari of Unicbank. "I believe considerable amounts may have went (before the cuts into reverse repo deals) to the National Bank of Hungary (NBH)."
On Monday, the central bank cut all four repo rates by 0.5 percent, with the one-week reverse repo falling to 21 percent.

"I think many banks placed substantial amounts in one-week reverse repo deals (before the repo cuts)," said Levente Fulop of Magyar Fejlesztesi Bank, adding that this must have tightened the forint liquidity of some banks.
Traders said the banks needed money to replenish their reserves and for tax-payments on February 20.
However, money supply on the market has not weakened substantially and the overnight rates may reverse the current rising trend this week or early next week, traders said.
